entry.title: Time in C++: Closing Thoughts
entry.summary: Time is time. We tend to think it’s simple to deal with it. But it’s more complex than it sounds. Both in programming and in real life. You want to measure how long something took, add a timestamp to a log entry, schedule a task for later, or display a date to a user in their local time. Each of these sounds straightforward — until clocks jump, time zones shift, or tests start failing randomly...
